contextId.information: The double negatives in this statement can be stated with positive terms. AT: "This shows that God can do anything." Elizabeth's pregnancy was proof that God was able to do anythingâ€”even enable Mary to become pregnant without her sleeping with a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: nothing will be impossible for God

contextId.information: The double negative can be replaced. AT: "near the house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
This double-negative can be written as a positive statement. AT: "everything that is hidden will be made known" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: nothing is hidden that will not be made known

contextId.information: This can be stated with positive verbs. AT: "only those of you who give up all that you have can be my disciples" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: any one of you who does not give up all that he has cannot be my disciple

contextId.information: This could be stated in positive form. AT: "everyone who has left ... will receive" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: there is no one who has left ... who will not receive
